#SleepRegularity - dev
this is kind of insane rn

Notes:
Seems to be calcultaing well, we need to ensure we are only inputting people who have good data though... and maybe double check its working!
```{r}
merged <- merged %>%
  mutate(
    sleeponset_minutes = {
      t <- hms(format(sleeponset_time, "%H:%M:%S"))
      hour(t) * 60 + minute(t) + second(t)/60 + 720
    },
    wakeup_minutes = {
      t <- hms(format(wakeup_time, "%H:%M:%S"))
      hour(t) * 60 + minute(t) + second(t)/60 + 720
    }
  )

make_binary <- function(onset, wake) {
  epoch <- 720:(720+1439)

  if (is.na(onset) || is.na(wake)) return(rep(NA, 1440))

  if (onset <= wake) {
    as.integer(epoch >= onset & epoch <= wake)
  } else {
    as.integer(epoch >= onset | epoch <= wake)
  }
}

merged <- merged %>%
  mutate(night = as.numeric(night))

merged <- merged %>%
  arrange(subject_id, filename, night) %>%
  group_by(subject_id, filename) %>%
  mutate(
    epoch_binary = map2(sleeponset_minutes, wakeup_minutes, make_binary),
    next_binary  = lead(epoch_binary),
    next_night   = lead(night),
    
    SRI2 = map2_dbl(epoch_binary, next_binary, ~{
      if(all(is.na(.x)) || all(is.na(.y))) return(NA_real_)
      mean(.x == .y, na.rm = TRUE) * 100
    }),
    
    SRI2 = ifelse(next_night - night == 1, SRI2, NA_real_)
  ) %>%
  ungroup()

merged$SRI2_scaled <- (merged$SRI2 * 2) - 100
```

```{r}

#Creating FHR Variable and Weekend
merged <- merged %>%
  mutate(fhr = ifelse(group %in% c(1, 2, 3), 1, 0))

merged$weekend <- ifelse(merged$weekday %in% 
                         c("Fri", "Friday", "Sat", "Saturday"), 1, 0)
#Labeling
merged$fhr <- factor(merged$fhr,
                       levels = c(0, 1),
                       labels = c("Control", "FHR"))
merged$group <- factor(merged$group,
                       levels = c(0, 1, 2, 3),
                       labels = c("Control", "MDD Risk", "BD Risk", "Psy Risk"))
merged$sex <- factor(merged$sex,
                       levels = c(0, 1),
                       labels = c("Male", "Female"))
merged$weekend <- factor(merged$weekend,
                         levels = c(0, 1),
                         labels = c("Weekday", "Weekend"))
merged$age <- as.numeric(merged$age)
merged$subject_id <- as.factor(merged$subject_id)
merged$SleepDurationInSpt <- as.numeric(merged$SleepDurationInSpt)

#Remove Psy Risk and Those without gruop
length(unique(merged$subject_id))
merged <- merged %>% filter(age < 25 & age >= 8)
merged <- merged %>% filter(group != 'Psy Risk')

table(merged$group)

merged <- merged %>%
  mutate(
    mdd = factor(ifelse(group == "MDD Risk", 1, 0), levels = c(0, 1)),
    bd  = factor(ifelse(group == "BD Risk", 1, 0), levels = c(0, 1))
  )

merged <- merged %>%
  group_by(filename) %>%  
  filter(
    sum(weekend == "Weekend", na.rm = TRUE) >= 1,
```

```{r}
               max(merged$age, na.rm = TRUE),
               length.out = 200)

# Create a new data frame with average covariate values
newdat <- expand.grid(
  age = age_seq,
  fhr = factor(levels(merged$fhr), levels = levels(merged$fhr)),
  sex = factor(levels(merged$sex)[1], levels = levels(merged$sex)),         # hold sex constant
  weekend = factor(levels(merged$weekend)[1], levels = levels(merged$weekend))  # hold weekend constant
)

# Assign one subject ID (for random effects if included)
newdat$subject_id <- factor(merged$subject_id[1], levels = levels(merged$subject_id))

#
pred <- predict(nonlinear$gam, newdata = newdat, se.fit = TRUE, exclude = "s(subject_id)")

newdat$fit <- pred$fit
newdat$se <- pred$se.fit
z <- qnorm(0.975)  # 1.96
newdat <- newdat %>%
  mutate(
    lower = fit - z * se,
    upper = fit + z * se
```

####Table
```{R}
#========================
# Helper functions
#========================
sig_stars <- function(p) {
  dplyr::case_when(
    is.na(p)  ~ "",
    p < 0.001 ~ "***",
    p < 0.01  ~ "**",
    p < 0.05  ~ "*",
    p < 0.10  ~ ".",
    TRUE      ~ ""
  )
}
fmt_num <- function(x, digits = 2) sprintf(paste0("%.", digits, "f"), x)

#========================
# FIXED EFFECTS (RAW -> formatted)
#========================
raw_fixed <- broom.mixed::tidy(
  nonlinear_order$lme,
  effects = "fixed",
  conf.int = TRUE
)

keep_terms <- c("X(Intercept)", "Xfhr2.L", "Xsex2.L", "XweekendWeekend")

mod1 <- raw_fixed %>%
  filter(term %in% keep_terms) %>%
  mutate(
    term = recode(
      term,
      "X(Intercept)"    = "Intercept",
      "Xfhr2.L"         = "FHR (Group)",
      "Xsex2.L"      = "Sex (Female)",
      "XweekendWeekend" = "Weekend",
      .default = term
    ),
    stars = sig_stars(p.value),
    `Effect (95% CI)` = paste0(
      fmt_num(estimate, 2),
      " (", fmt_num(conf.low, 2), ", ", fmt_num(conf.high, 2), ")",
      stars
    )
  ) %>%
  select(term, `Effect (95% CI)`)


#========================
# SMOOTH TERMS (edf + F + stars)
#========================
smooth_table <- as.data.frame(summary(nonlinear_order$gam)$s.table)

tbl_smooth <- smooth_table %>%
  rownames_to_column("term") %>%
  mutate(
    term = recode(
      term,
      "s(age)"         = "Smooth(Age)",
      "s(age):fhr2FHR" = "Smooth(Age) Ã— FHR"
    ),
    stars = sig_stars(`p-value`),
    `Effect (95% CI)` = paste0(
      fmt_num(F, 2), " (edf=", fmt_num(edf, 2), ")",
      stars
    )
  ) %>%
  select(term, `Effect (95% CI)`)

#========================
# Divider row + Combine
#========================
divider <- tibble(
  term = "Smooth Terms",
  `Effect (95% CI)` = ""
)

combined_df <- bind_rows(
  mod1,
  divider,
  tbl_smooth
)

combined_table <- flextable(combined_df) %>%
  set_caption("Model: Sleep Regularity â€” General Additive Model") %>%
  bold(i = nrow(mod1) + 1, j = 1) %>%  # bold "Smooth Terms"
  autofit()

save_as_docx(
  "Model: Sleep Regularity â€” GAM" = combined_table,
  path = "SRI_GAM_Table.docx"
)
```

```{r}
apa_format <- function(model){
  broom.mixed::tidy(model, effects = "fixed", conf.int = TRUE) %>%
    mutate(
      Predictor = recode(term,
        "(Intercept)"     = "Intercept",
        "fhr2.L"          = "FHR",
        "age"             = "Age",
        "fhr2.L:age"      = "FHR Ã— Age",
        "groupMDD Risk"            = "MDD",
        "groupBD Risk"             = "BD",
        "groupMDD Risk:age"        = "Age Ã— MDD",
        "groupBD Risk:age"         = "Age Ã— BD",
        "sexFemale"       = "Sex (Female)",
        "weekendWeekend"  = "Weekend"
      ),
      stars = dplyr::case_when(
        p.value < .001 ~ "***",
        p.value < .01  ~ "**",
        p.value < .05  ~ "*",
        TRUE           ~ ""
      ),
      `Î² [95% CI]` = sprintf("%.2f%s [%.2f, %.2f]", estimate, stars, conf.low, conf.high)
    ) %>%
    select(Predictor, `Î² [95% CI]`)
}

)
```

###Visualisation
```{r}
pred <- predict(
  mod1,
  newdata = newdat,
  re.form = NA,     # population-level predictions
  se.fit  = TRUE
)

newdat$fit_star <- pred$fit
newdat$se_star  <- pred$se.fit


# --- 4. Build 95% CI on transformed scale ---
z <- qnorm(0.975)

newdat$lower_star <- newdat$fit_star - z * newdat$se_star
newdat$upper_star <- newdat$fit_star + z * newdat$se_star


# --- 5. Smearing correction (bias fix) ---
smear <- mean(exp(resid(mod1)), na.rm = TRUE)


# --- 6. Back-transform to ORIGINAL SRI SCALE (with bound flip) ---
newdat$fit   <- 100 - smear * exp(newdat$fit_star)

# --- 7. Observed data on ORIGINAL SCALE (unchanged) ---
sum <- merged %>%
  group_by(filename) %>%
  summarise(
    SRIm = mean(SRI2_scaled, na.rm = TRUE),  # original SRI
    age  = mean(age, na.rm = TRUE),
    fhr  = first(fhr)
  )


# --- 8. Final plot: transformed model shown on ORIGINAL scale ---

  ) +
```
